item.title: Shadow of the Erdtree: Somewhere A Great Rune Has Broken Meaning – Elden Ring DLC
item.description:
While exploring Scadu Altus in Elden Ring: Shadow of the Erdtree DLC, the moment you come close to the Shadow Keep from any angle, a message will pop up on your screen announcing an event happening right now. The message reads that Somewhere, a Great Rune has broken… And so, too, has a powerful charm.

This event leads to many changes in the world around you, especially among Miquella’s followers. So, it’s better to visit to check their new dialogues. The good news is, after getting the message of a Great Rune has broken, you won’t be locked out of any story quest unless you keep progressing further and taking down more bosses in Elden Ring Shadow of the Erdtree DLC.

There's still a lot to discover regarding the Somewhere, a Great Rune has broken… Message in the Elden Ring Shadow of the Erdtree DLC. This guide will cover what's known so far, and will be updated once more information is available.

Somewhere A Great Rune Has Broken Meaning In Elden Ring Shadow of the Erdtree

After getting the Great Rune has broken notification in Elden Ring Shadow of the Erdtree DLC, you’ll notice that many of Miquella’s followers change their behavior and beliefs. Talking to them may clarify their intentions now after the Great Rune is broken, but it may also cloud your judgment even further while progressing their questlines in Elden Ring . The next list will contain some minor spoilers while going over the changes that occur after hearing the Great Rune breaking in Elden Ring SotE DLC

The information below will contain some spoilers.

Stone Coffin Fissure

While exploring the southern shores, you’ll come across a cave sealed and obscured by Miquella. After the Great Rune breaks, the seal keeping you from entering the Stone Coffin Fissure will also break. In this cave, you’ll be able to progress St. Trina and Thiollier's questlines.

Thiollier

Thiollier remembers St. Trina and shares that he would sacrifice everything just to gaze upon her one last time. You can tell him where she is, and he will go there to meet her. There, he will look poisoned and ill, wishing that soon he would fall into an eternal slumber just to hear her voice.

You can pass on her words to him, which will get him mad, and declare he’s the chosen, not you. He will then threaten you if you utter those words again, which is what you will definitely do. After doing so, rest at the Site of Lost Grace outside and he will invade you. You can find Thiollier dying next to St. Trina after he invades you, regretting his entire life, begging you to tell the truth. Passing on St. Trina's words again would get him mad and desperate to hear her voice.

Freyja

There’s not much known about Freyja at this point, as she has just moved to the Shadow Keep. She’s apparently trying to find something there while regretting not asking Ansbach to impart his knowledge when she had the chance.

Hornsent

Hornsent wasn’t kind from the start to Marika and her offspring, yet, somehow he was one of Miquella's followers. After the Great Rune Break, you quickly learn from Hornsent that they were under Miquella’s spell. Without being influenced by the spell, Hornsent still somewhat believes in Miquella while his desire for vengeance ignites, setting his next target to be Messmer, the Impaler.

Needle Knight Leda

Leda feels that Miquella’s enchantment has been broken, but quickly announces her devotion to Miquella remains unchanged. However, she’s not sure about the others. This gives her the idea of wielding her sword against the undeserving, giving you the option to suggest one of them. Here, you have three choices:

  1. Suggest Thiollier
  2. Suggest the Hornsent
  3. Make no suggestion

If you suggest Thiollier, she will not consider him to be threatening. If you make no suggestion or choose the Hornsent, she will go after him since she’s concerned he might take down Miquella. Eventually, as you explore further into the Shadow Keep, you’ll find both the Needle Knight Leda and the Hornsent’s Summon Signs next to each other. You can choose to either help Leda or Hornsent.

Moore

Moore shares that he doesn’t feel Miquella’s light while stating he’s sad because of Leda’s recent actions. Here you have three choices:

  1. Put it behind you.
  2. Remain sad forever.
  3. I don’t know.

The third option is considered not choosing as Moore will keep asking what to do, and you’ll keep getting the same choices. Eventually, the results of the first or second choices can only be witnessed towards the end of the Shadow of the Erdtree DLC in Elden Ring .

item.title: Pokemon GO: All Wild Encounters For the Anniversary Event
item.description:
Quick Links

  • All Wild Encounters During Pokemon GO's Anniversary Event
  • All New Wild Pokemon Encounters
  • All Wild Pokemon Encounters That Are On Specific Days

Pokemon GO is still going strong after eight years. The game is even having a massive 8th Anniversary Event to celebrate the fact that fans are still loving the game. With this event comes a lot of wild Pokemon encounters that players will be able to partake in, which will allow players to get some coveted Pokemon.

During the event, there will be new Pokemon, Pokemon whose spawn rate will be increased during the duration of the event, and Pokemon whose spawn rate will only be increased during specific days. Here's everything players need to know about the wild Pokemon encounters during this event.

All Wild Encounters During Pokemon GO's Anniversary Event

Niantic and the Pokemon Company have a lot planned for the Anniversary Event. Here are all the wild Pokemon encounters that will take place during the entire duration of the event. In addition to these Pokemon, players can use Mystery Boxes more often and may find a Shiny Meltan.

Any Pokemon with a * beside them can be Shiny during the event.

  • Bulbasaur wearing a party hat*
  • Charmander wearing a party hat*
  • Squirtle wearing a party hat*
  • Pikachu wearing a cake hat*
  • Eevee wearing a party hat*
  • Sprigatito
  • Fuecoco
  • Quaxly
  • Alolan Grimer

All New Wild Pokemon Encounters

The event is bringing brand new Pokemon to the game as well. For the first time ever, players will be able to catch the following Pokemon:

Any Pokemon with a * beside them can be Shiny during the event.

  • Grimer wearing a party hat*
  • Muk wearing a party hat

All Wild Pokemon Encounters That Are On Specific Days

While some Pokemon will be seen the entirety of the event, others will only be seen more often during specific times. There are chances to encounter these Pokemon outside these times, but they will have a much higher spawn rate during specific days.

Any Pokemon with a * beside them can be Shiny during the event.

Here are Pokemon that can be encountered June 28 at 10:00 AM local time - June 29 at 11:59 PM local time

  • Chikorita*
  • Cyndaquil*
  • Totodile*
  • Treecko*
  • Torchic*
  • Mudkip*

These Pokemon can be seen June 30 at 12:00 AM local time - July 1 at 11:59 local time

  • Turtwig*
  • Chimchar*
  • Piplup*
  • Snivy*
  • Tepig*
  • Oshawott*

These Pokemon can be seen July 2 at 12:00 AM local time - July 3 at 8:00 PM local time

  • Chespin*
  • Fennekin*
  • Froakie*
  • Rowlet*
  • Litten*
  • Popplio

item.title: Pax Dei: How to Get Clay
item.description:
In Pax Dei , you are placed in the medieval era where you begin your journey with nothing but the resources naturally available in the environment. It’s like being a caveman, everything you will have to build from scratch, using resources you can gather from your surroundings.

As such, it is essential to make the most of these resources to craft weapons, armor, and a shelter that will determine your chances of survival. In order to establish a shelter, you will need clay. If you are new to the game and wondering where to look for this valuable asset, this guide will be of great help.

How to Get Clay

Clay is one of the valuable resources in Pax Dei which is used to craft many essential items, such as bricks, walls, stairs, doorways, and more. These items are crucial for building your base, so you will need a substantial amount of clay.

Luckily, unlike some other resources, you can collect Clay without using any tools. To find Clay, look for Clay deposits scattered throughout the world . These deposits usually have a distinctive brown color and a rocky appearance. When you locate a Clay deposit, approach it and interact with it by pressing E to farm the Clay .

Where to Find Clay

Finding clay in Pax Dei can be a bit tricky due to its random spawn locations. However, it is usually found near river banks or nearby water areas. One important thing to keep in mind is that you will usually find it at a fair distance from the shore, not right beside the water. So whenever you are going for Clay, make sure to look out the area slightly away from river banks.

There is a good chance that other players may have already collected Clay from these spots. There won't be any indication that Clay was previously there, so you might pass by multiple spawn points without noticing it. Clay deposits usually re-appear regularly after a few hours, which means you can mine them again and again from the same location.

How to Use Clay

Once you've gathered Clay, you can then use it to craft a variety of items for your survival and progression in the game. Here's a list of a few of these items you can craft using Clay:

  • Basic Forge
  • Brazier
  • Bread Oven
  • Bricks
  • Charcoal Kiln
  • Clay Shingles
  • Cooking Hearth
  • Doorways
  • Flower Pots
  • Foundations
  • Millstone
  • Roof Supports
  • Stairs
  • Walls

item.title: Monopoly GO: Shark Track Rewards And Milestones
item.description:

To rack up points in the Shark Track tournament, fans should aim for the Railroad squares on your board. In total, they can grab up to 6,210 dice by achieving all milestones.

  • Large: 12 Points
  • Bankrupt: 16 Points.

item.title: Destiny 2: 7 Characters Who Are Now Dead
item.description:
Highlights

  • Some characters in Destiny 2 meet tragic ends, making returning Guardians nostalgic for those lost in the Light and Darkness saga.
  • Sacrifices from characters like Targe, Cayde-6, and Sagira enrich the emotional depth of Destiny 2's evolving storyline.
  • Characters like Amanda Holliday, Rasputin, and Lakshmi-2 also face tragic fates, adding layers to the complex universe of Destiny 2.

The story of Destiny 2 continues to evolve over the course of seasons, episodes, and expansions. With each new story that is brought to Destiny 2 , some players might have had to say goodbye to some characters that they have met over the course of this 10-year journey. Not every character gets a happy ending, and for some, their stories are cut short, especially during the Light and Darkness saga where sacrifices and devotion were made to ensure the Guardians live one more day.

Whether characters didn’t deserve death or otherwise, Guardians who are returning to Destiny 2 after some years away might have missed a few things. It’s always a sad story to return to the Tower and realise that a few favorites aren’t coming home, but they can be fondly remembered.

7 Targe

Killed By The Witness

A steady rock to Zavala in these trying times, Targe was a Ghost that everyone needed. Headstrong, loyal, and mostly silent, offering advice when necessary, Targe was forever with Commander Zavala, in his brightest and darkest moments. Yet, Targe was taken too soon in sacrifice for Zavala, ensuring that his last act of heroism and bearing the Light would ensure the safety of his Guardian.

In Zavala's desire to learn more about the Witness, and in his frustration with the Traveler, he succumbed to Darkness momentarily. In this seduction by the Witness, Targe stepped in to bring Zavala back to his Fireteam. Targe was crushed mercilessly by the Witness for trying to save Zavala, and even though the Titan Vanguard is now Lightless, Targe’s memory burns bright.

6 The Witness

Killed And Unmade By The Guardians

The ultimate threat of the universe, the Witness started its war with the Traveler eons ago. The Witness was once the first known civilization gifted prosperity by the Traveler. Yet, in a conquest for purpose, the Witness species merged into one entity to master the Darkness and seek finality and an end to suffering, salvation to bring about the stillness of the universe that resulted in no life, but also no death.

The Witness’ attempt to craft the Final Shape required the Traveler, and within its Pale Heart, its origins and weakness were exposed. The Witness was destroyed and unmade by Guardians after cutting out resistors, veiled statues that would help break the billions of minds that made this entity. With the Witness unmade, it ceased to exist, providing an ultimate death to a thankful universe.

5 Amanda Holliday

Killed In A Shadow Legion Explosion

Amanda Holliday was adored by all, and it seemed every Guardian that spent time in the Tower and the Last City would know of Amanda Holliday. This woman came to the Last City when she was a child. An orphan seeking a bright future in the stars, she managed to reach great heights and aided Guardians without the power of immortality provided by a Ghost or the Light.

Yet, this lack of immortality is what got her killed. During the Black Fleet’s invasion, and the rounding up of humans, Amanda aided the Guardian and Crow in rescuing humans. Sadly, there was a trap set by the Black Fleet, and Amanda was killed in an explosion, robbing the Last City of one of its best and most loved.

4 Cayde-6

Sacrificed His Light To Bring Back The Guardian’s Ghost

The beloved Hunter Vanguard returned during the events of The Final Shape. Whilst Cayde-6 already had his final death, it’s impossible not to add him to the list, considering he has once again become one with the Light. Cayde-6’s return was met with triumph and intrigue. Was he the Traveler’s chosen to be resurrected once more? No, he was but a wish from Crow.

Cayde-6 may have come back, but it was brief enough to be the perfect resurrection. Cayde-6 loved being alive with his friends again, but he longed to return to the peacefulness of unity with the Light with his Ghost, Sundance. As such, Cayde-6 sacrificed his Light so that the Guardian’s Ghost could return. Although Cayde is dead, again, part of him lives on in Ghost.

3 Rasputin

Destroyed Himself To Stop The Warsat Network From Attacking The Traveler

Rasputin was created during the Golden Age by BrayTech, and his own identity was forged through teachings, creating a sentient AI that would defend humanity on his own terms with no equal to stop him. Rasputin may have committed some atrocities in the past, but his focus will always be on ensuring humanity’s safety, especially as the Black Fleet approaches once again.

It seemed that hope was returning to humanity, as Ana Bray was busy in building Rasputin an exo body. From here, Rasputin was going to be able to connect back to the Warsat Network, controlling the subminds and giving humanity back the arsenal that could defend it from destruction once more. Yet, Eramis managed to activate the Warsat arsenal to try and destroy the Traveler, so Rasputin activated its own self-destruct protocol to stop this attack, destroying himself as the last Warmind, but proving his heart as a machine.

2 Sagira

Sacrificed Herself To Stop Osiris From Being Killed By Xivu Arath’s High Celebrant

The witty and loyal Ghost of the legendary Warlock Osiris, Sagira would join him for centuries of adventures. The duo were together, always, and always respective of each other. They made for a great team as they sought to uncover and foil many of the Vex’s plans. Yet, even immortality could not save them, as Sagira was struck down, robbing Osiris of a dear friend and the Light.

Sagira was killed by the High Celebrant of Xivu Arath, the Hive God of War. Sagira sacrificed herself to make sure that she was struck down instead of Osiris, and this left him without a Ghost. Sagira’s sacrifice shows the devotion Ghosts have to their Guardians, and Osiris is a walking reminder of the grief he feels for Sagira.

1 Lakshmi-2

Killed By The Vex After Opening A Portal For Them In The Last City

Beginning her story in Destiny (2014), Lakshmi-2 is introduced as an Exo, a human from the Golden Age of humanity. She led the Future War Cult, providing a deep story in the lore. Yet, much of it came to ruin due to her prejudice and mistrust of the Eliksni people that developed further into Destiny 2 .

Lakshmi-2 was no friend of the Eliksni and the Fallen, so when the House of Hope were invited to seek refuge in the Last City, Lakshmi-2 was one of the first to openly object to them. Lakshmi’s openness to xenophobia and her fear of a friendly Fallen house made her dangerous. Dangerous enough to open a portal for the Vex into the Last City in an attempt to drive out the Eliksni. Her efforts were for nothing, as Guardians, humanity, and Eliksni banded together to stop the Vex. With Lakshmi-2 dead, Future War Cult disbanded. Lakshmi’s story may not be over, as Guardians recently discovered she was a copy of Maya Sundaresh.
